alert.note: Alert for Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 02 at 5:48PM CDT until June 02 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern Glasscock County in western Texas... Ector County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... East central Winkler County in western Texas... Southwestern Howard County in western Texas... Southeastern Martin County in western Texas... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 547 PM CDT, a dust channel was near Midland International Air and Space Port, or 7 miles southwest of Midland, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 99 and 164. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Greenwood, Stanton, Goldsmith, Midland International Air and Space Port, West Odessa, Cotton Flat, Warfield, Midland Airpark, Skywest Airport, Courtney, Odessa Schlemeyer Field, Notrees, Penwell, Stanton Municipal Aiport and Spraberry. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Winkler
